intro: Psiadia lucida, commonly known as the shining sandmat, is a flowering plant native to arid and semi-arid regions of southern Africa. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, characterized by its composite flower heads that resemble small daisies. The plant has slender, branching stems covered in fine, white hairs, which help reduce water loss in its harsh environment. Its yellow flowers bloom in spring, attracting pollinators such as bees and butterflies. Psiadia lucida is often found growing on rocky soils and in open, sunny habitats.
